{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492367,"name":null,"username":"6528TerrorBytes","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/6/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T16:07:12.216Z","cooked":"

When I hold an AprilTag in front of my Limelight 2, MegaTag2 just shows that the robot is in the very center of the field, rather than moving along with the AprilTag. MegaTag1 does show the robot moving around according to the AprilTag, however.

I have a temporary setup to run the Limelight for testing as the build team is working on the chasis right now, so all the robot internals are just spread out on my desk. I do not have any other subsystems or commands running since no motors are connected (It’s just the Rio, power hub, battery, radio, and limelight). I am running all my Limelight-related code within the Robot.java robotPeriodic() function for now for testing.

I’m calling the LimelightHelpers.setRobotOrientation() function with a rotation of 0 within it, and getting the robot position via the LimelightHelpers.getBotPoseEstimate_wpiBlue_MegaTag2() function. It always returns a Pose on the field of around (8, 4), which is the center of the field, and where it displays the robot in the Limelight dashboard:

image945×420 43.3 KB

(I’m just waving an AprilTag around above the Limelight, which is why the yellow MegaTag1’s position on the right is so strange. MegaTag2 is just stuck there at the center of the field, shown in green on the left, and that’s the issue)

I’ve recently updated it to the latest 2025 Limelight software, but it was doing this before I updated as well.

Perhaps I’m missing something? Thanks.

You set the robot orientation as 0. Consider what AprilTag to view where a robot orientation of 0 makes sense. Then move the AprilTag a little bit and see what MT2 does for you.

@SLAB-Mr.Thomas is right, your Limelight is saying “whatever is going on here is geometrically unresolvable”

I would also recommend taking a look at your configured camera pose and configured robot orientation
